I also recall a not too long ago translation I did for Token to Rekishi of
Hagihara sensei's frontispiece where he specially mentioned a painter who
inspired the work of a kinko, but it escapes me.

 

Gordon

 

-----Original Message-----
From: Jim Gilbert [mailto:jggilbert@...] 
Sent: Tuesday, January 13, 2004 8:42 AM
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] tsuba designs?

 

Yes, the Natsuo Taikan by Miyake Teruyoshi.  8 volumes and something over
2,400 pages.  I was tempted, but didn't buy.

Jim


  I might add to this that Kano Natsuo was also a very original designer and
  the set of books on him (way expensive) that was done by the guys at the
  fittings museum (I think) included at least one entire volume on his
  paintings and designs. A bit too specialized for me, but very interesting
to
  see how he worked up from paper to metal.



  Gordon
